name: The Darlington Hyde Park

reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.text: What a great hotel! Having stayed in a microscopic London hotel about 5 years ago as well as having stayed at a guest house with small space in York a few days prior, we did not have high hopes. I chose this hotel based on good reviews from Trip Advisor.

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: Upon check in to our "family" room - 1 queen 1 twin, we found that it had 2 separate rooms! It was a very clean, extremely comfortable room with the added bonus of privacy from our 6 year old! The towels were HUGE compared to most we have experienced, and they had nice soft American-style toilet paper. The full English breakfast was great, service was nice. We got an excellent recommendation for dinner at Noor Jahan, an Indian place down the road - it was great (expensive like most of London). We just can't recommend this hotel enough, it was 2 blocks from Paddington Station, it exceeded our expectations.

Stayed at the Darlington for 6 nights and it is a wonderful hotel. Extremely clean rooms and large baths (for the Paddington area and type of hotel) with a most friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was great and a good way to start the day. I highly recommend this hotel for the above reasons and also for the price. I will stay here each time I return. All around excellent hotel.
reviews.title: Darlington was great
Great for the price, good location for Paddington
reviews.text: We did a quick trip to London and we chose this hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor. I have to say we were extremely pleased with our stay at the Darlington. The room was small but very clean and had all necessary amenities for our stay, including a small refrigerator and in-room safe. We had a room on the inside of the building (i.e. away from the main street) and did not hear any traffic noise at all. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast (included with the room rate) was excellent as well. The location close to Paddington Station made the commute to and from Heathrow a breeze. I would highly recommend this hotel!

reviews.title: Lovely little hotel
reviews.text: RH from Arroyo Grande California

Stayed here on 2 ocassions in July. We were there in the middle of a heat wave but we were provided with fans on both ocassions. On our first stay we were given a room that faced the a inner courtyard so we had no noise problems if we opened the balcony. On our second stay we were given a room that faced the street and was next to the elevator, the public telephone and the reception entrance. To be honest we had no problems with the noise and slept very well. The hotel staff is very helpful. The breakfast was very good indeed and the girls who serve it are very nice. The hotel even has a laundry room for the use of the guests, that was a plus for us because we were travelling with a 10 month old baby. It's a bit pricey to operate the washer and dryer but the price includes the detergent and softener. The bathrooms are very clean. Our rooms included a mini fridge and safe box. The location is superb as Paddington station is just a few blocks away. Hyde Park is also very near and we enjoyed walking there with our baby. We will definetly stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Darlington Hyde Park Hotel on two separate nights in July 2006 about 2 weeks apart. Both of these nights happened to be in the middle of a heat wave that was effecting most of southern England. Unfortunately neither of the rooms we stayed in had air conditioning, which meant we had to leave the windows open to have any chance of getting any sleep. This would have been fine, except that the rooms face the street and there is traffic on that street all night long. Suffice to say we did not have good sleeps either of the nights.
reviews.title: Good location, but hot and noisey
Darlington gets a 5
reviews.text: On the good side, however, the hotel staff were very polite and the rooms were impeccably clean. The shower had good water pressure, and the safe in the room was a nice bonus. Finally, the hotel is not 5 minutes walk from Paddington Station, which is SO convenient; Paddington is a major underground station and also has express trains to Heathrow airport. So instead of spending 60 pounds for a 40 minute cab ride to the airport, you spend ~20 pounds for a 15 minute express train ride. And when you want to travel around the city for sight seeing, the Underground is minutes away.

Also, the room rates were pretty good. The second night we stayed we were in a smaller room than the first night, which was fine for us since all we needed to do was sleep...and it was only 89 pounds!! That's almost unheard of for a hotel room in London.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
We loved this hotel!
reviews.text: I would recommend the DHPH as long as there is no need for air conditioning and you can keep your windows closed. Otherwise you'll be hot and kept up by the traffic noise.

We stayed for 4 nights at the end of May and found the hotel quite nice. Yes our room was on the small side but we expected that. The hotel is very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was located on the front of the hotel and we did get some road noise in the morning but with the heavy curtains this was not any issue. Breakfast is served in a room downstairs and you get a few choices such as english breakfast, continental or eggs cooked to order. The lady that waited on us was very frindly and in a great mood each day. BTW: the english bacon is excellent, much better than we get here in the states.
reviews.title: An excellent stay...

reviews.text: The area around the hotel is nice and quiet with many pubs and restraunts within a few blocks. The hotel has a brochure which highlights the top restraunts in the area as picked by other travelers. We tried the Indian restraunt and found it very good. As well, a couple blocks from the hotel is The Victoria Pub which we found to have the best steak and ale pie. As well, Paddington Station and Lancaster Gate are both a short walk so you get hit a few different tube lines.
reviews.title: Brilliant place to stay

reviews.text: Downside?...no wash clothes are provided so be sure to take your own.....no iron avalable in the room but there is one located in the laundry downstairs.....Wi-fi for 5 pounds and hour or 10 for 24 hours.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: As a whole we had a great trip although as mentioned on the forum, London is quite an expensive town due to the exchange rate for us Americans. And with smoking allowed everywhere it made it hard to sit inside of the pubs for long.
reviews.title: Dee-lighted

reviews.text: Jeff
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!
Large, clean rooms
reviews.text: We (family of 4 with 2 teenagers) just returned from Europe. We spent 3 nights at the Darlington. We found the rooms to be large and clean. The beds were comfortable. There was a lot of street noise on the front of the hotel, none on the back. The breakfast was large and satisfying. While we were in London there was a heat wave (about 87 degrees for several days). The hotel does not have air conditioned rooms. Luckily each room does have a fan. The rooms were unbearably hot until after dark. The location was fine--in a row of hotels about 5 minutes from Paddington Station. We were near a large street (Euston?) which had many Middle Eastern restaurants. Cafe Maroush (Lebonese) was delicious but pricey (what isn't in London?). The Monkey Puzzle, down the street) was a nice pub with outdoor picnic tables where they barbeque at night.

reviews.title: The Darlington Hotel, A Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: Have just spent 2 days at the Darlington Hotel, Hyde Park, would highly recommend it for a short break in the capital. The staff are very friendly and helpful,me and mum had a twin room on the 4th floor, there was a lift, the beds were very clean and comfortable, the towels were very big and fluffy, the only downside was, that as it was so warm, we had the windows open, and then had the 24 hour noise of London below, there was a fan in the room and we also had a fridge and a safe. Breakfast was really nice, a help yourself buffet of cereals, rolls, yoghurts, fruit and fruit juice, then a cooked breakfast all included in the price, hotel is very convenient, only 5 mins to hyde park, paddington and lancaster gate tube, and a 15-20 min walk to Oxford Street/Notting Hill, found 2 streets with restaurants on very close by, can highly recommend ASK, for its pasta,s, salads, pizza and chocolate brownie cheesecake!!, would have no hestiation in choosing to stay here again.

My wife and I stayed in the Darlington Hyde Park in May. We selected the Darlington Hyde Park after thorough research - in particular TripAdvisor which has become our standard for travel reviews - and it lived up to our expectations. The hotel was very clean and upscale. The staff was friendly, professional, and informative and went out of their way to accommodate our needs - both before and during our stay. Our room was clean and quiet, and although on the small side compared to US stds, it suited our needs very well. The in-room refrigerator and safe were a plus, as were the location and proximity to Paddington Station. The Darlington Hyde Park serves an excellent English breakfast. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Darlington Hyde Park is Wonderful!
Clean hotel, friendly staff
reviews.text: On the plus side, the hotel was clean, the staff friendly and helpful-especially the breakfast staff. We looked forward to breakfast every morning in the sunny room with the limited cook- to-order menu-they were our best breakfasts all over Europe! The bathtub was nice and very deep and relaxing after a day of sightseeing. The location was good- it took 15 minutes to get to Paddington tube station on the Heathrow Express. Paddington tube was a 10 minute walk to the hotel. Paddington had too many stairs for my 70 year old mother to negotiate, so we were relieved that Lancaster Gate tube station was only a 10 minute walk and had only 1 set of stairs.

reviews.title: Not worth it
reviews.text: On the negative side the room was cold-regardless of what temperature the thermostat was set at, the towel warmer wasn't working, the safe wouldn't accept any of my 3 American credit cards to lock it up, and we had a twin room (2 twin beds) but the bed had no top sheet and the blanket could be too warm at times. The room faced a noisy street and I had to use earplugs. You have to leave your room key in a slot just inside the door to work the electricity. The carpeting and bedding appeared shabby. We did enjoy the hot tea and biscuits in our room every afternoon.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: My colleague and I have just returned from a one night stay at the Darlington Hotel. I chose it based on the reviews on this site and I was not disappointed.

reviews.title: I'm hard to please, believe me!
reviews.text: The hotel is a few minutes walk from Paddington Station and in a nice enough area. It was very late in the evening when we arrived and we wanted to just check in, unpack, and find somewhere to eat.

reviews.title: The perfect place to stay in London!!!
reviews.text: The staff on reception were very friendly and helpful and even recommended a nearby italian restaurant to us which by the way was excellent.

reviews.title: Darlington is Great
reviews.text: One good feature of this hotel is security. Upon check in you are issued with a key card which you need to get into your room. However, unlike many other hotels, where anybody can wander in off the street, you need this key card just to get into the foyer - a very good idea!

reviews.title: Clean,Friendly,Good Location
reviews.text: Each room has a small fridge for putting your own stuff in, a small kettle and sachets of tea and coffee, and most significantly a safe. The safe appears to be very secure and although you need to use your credit card to open the safe, you are not charged for doing this.

We stayed at the Darlington in mid-June 2006. We had a suite on the 4th floor, which had a sitting room on the noisy street side, a bathroom, and a bedroom on the quieter backside. The rooms were ok-not very big, and, as others here have said, somewhat shabby, but clean. London was very hot at that time, which made the room sometimes sweltering. No air conditioning, and opening the windows let in a lot of street noise. I would not have wanted to be in a regular room facing the street. There was a fan, which did ok, but it never really cooled down. On 2 of the days we were there, the elevator didn't work, so it was a haul going up 4 floors-fortunately it worked when we had to transport the luggage. The staff is friendly enough, and the location is convenient to bus, underground, and train transportation. There are tons of other hotels and restaurants in the area, and the hotel did have a brochure listing about 10 nearby restaurants supposedly recommended by the guests-we tried a couple, and they were ok. Beware, however, that the Paddington area attracks some low lifes, who can be a hassle on the streets; when I was in one of the restaurants recommended by the hotel's brochure, one of these punks came in, started hassling me, and eventually punched me before running off. So be careful. Overall, given the high prices everywhere in London, the Darlington is OK for the money.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.text: We stayed at the Darlington Hyde Park for one night at the end of June. We had a room in the back of the hotel which was very small. The photos shown in other reviews are rooms in the front facing the street. Our room was not nearly that big. We had about a foot of walking space in between the bed and the built in desk. The bathroom was also extremely small. However, it definitely was clean and the staff was friendly. There was no A/C, but the room did have a fan. Breakfast was included, but dont believe the "eggs cooked to order". I asked for egg whites due to dietary issues, and was told "No, the kitchen was too busy". Overall, it was OK, but we stayed 4 nights after in the Hesperia London Victoria for the same price and it was much bigger, had A/C, pool and a workout area. The Darlington works as a budget hotel, but I think if you search you can find better for the same price.
reviews.title: Ok, but stayed at better for the same price

reviews.text: The reviews are right on as this hotel is a 'gem'. Excellent location, very helpful staff, incredible breakfast, nice room....
reviews.title: Darlington Hyde is as good as it gets
Highly recommended
reviews.text: We previously stayed in the same area at the Hyde Park Paddington Hotel aka worst hotel in London and the Darlington is no comparison, however was the same price??? Darlington is highly recommended!
Excellent tourist class hotel. Clean, spacious rooms. Friendly staff, good breakfast, excellent value for money. Suggest requesting room at the back of the hotel as the road outside is noisy 24/7.
reviews.title: Superb budget hotel

description: The Darlington Hyde Park is located in the Paddington Hyde Park area of London, less than a 5-minute walk from the Heathrow Express terminal at Paddington station. This 40-bedroom former stately Victorian terraced town house conversion offers high standard accommodation with modern facilities, which ensure that the expectations of both business and leisure travellers alike are fully met. The Darlington Hyde Park prides itself on being a strictly non-smoking establishment.
